summary: Pivoting from cold-email outreach to phone-first lead generation for Nigerian manufacturers requiring reliable gas-turbine power. Current challenge: acquiring verified decision-maker phone numbers in a data-sparse market.

decisions.decision: Prioritise phone-first outreach; email is secondary.
decisions.reason: Higher engagement potential in Nigerian context.

decisions.decision: Retire legacy email Python scripts; keep for reference only.
decisions.reason: Strategy pivot from email-first to phone-first outreach.

decisions.decision: Use Claude Opus deep-research to surface company & document URLs (not private numbers).
decisions.reason: Cost-effective broad discovery of public sources.

decisions.decision: Maintain existing company lists from May 2025 as valid starting targets.
decisions.reason: Credits already spent; data still relevant.

decisions.decision: Exclude RocketReach for now due to sparse Nigerian coverage.
Accept 30% WhatsApp-registration or live-connect rate as minimum viable accuracy for lead packs.
decisions.reason: User-defined success threshold for phone-number validity.

considerations.text: Leverage CAC filings, tender PDFs and supplier directories to mine phone numbers.
considerations.context: Potential public docs with direct contacts.

considerations.text: Use enrichment APIs (Apollo, PeopleDataLabs) for additional fields where available.
Implement WhatsApp Business API ping as lightweight number validity test.
Geo-target scrape by roads/estate clusters with high hotel/manufacturing density.
considerations.context: Idea from local operator; yet to prototype.

cross_project_insights.insight: Market-intel PDFs generated from scrape data can double as social-proof content for other sales initiatives.

conflicts.details: Firecrawl-based scraping pipeline documented in earlier README now deprecated.

side_discoveries.note: ROI calculator HTML still valuable as sales collateral for pitch decks.
